chapterSummary.General: Numbers 13 describes the sending of the twelve spies to explore Canaan and their report, emphasizing faith and trust in God's promises.
chapterSummary.Non-Denominational: This chapter highlights the importance of faith and trust in God's promises.
chapterSummary.Baptist: The chapter emphasizes the importance of faith and trust in God's promises in His work.
chapterSummary.Catholic: Numbers 13 illustrates the Church's understanding of faith and trust in God's promises.
chapterSummary.Methodist: This chapter shows the importance of faith and trust in God's promises in the community.
chapterSummary.Lutheran: The chapter demonstrates God's order and the importance of faith.
chapterSummary.Presbyterian: This chapter reflects God's covenant faithfulness and the importance of faith.
chapterSummary.Pentecostal: Numbers 13 shows the importance of spiritual faith and trust in God's promises in His kingdom.
chapterSummary.Anglican: The chapter demonstrates the importance of faith and trust in God's promises in the Church.
chapterSummary.Orthodox: This chapter reveals the sacred nature of faith and trust in God's promises.

2.General: Send some men to explore the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites. From each ancestral tribe send one of its leaders.

2.Anglican: The account highlights the importance of preparation and trust in God's promises in His plan.
2.Orthodox: This verse reveals the importance of preparation and trust in God's promises in His plan.

3.General: So at the Lord's command Moses sent them out from the Desert of Paran. All of them were leaders of the Israelites.
